snippet: Many abduction cases are not black-and-white stories of evil parents stealing away children from a loving home but rather result from domestic abuse situations.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Joan S Meier cites one main flaw of The Hague Convention on Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction is that in many cases children and custodial mothers are being sent back to dangerous or abusive fathers from whom they fled; calls on State Department and Congress to work to ensure that courts and countries implement more balanced application of convention.
lead_paragraph: Many abduction cases are not black-and-white stories of evil parents stealing away children from a loving home but rather result from domestic abuse situations.

headline.main: Home Is Where the Harm Is
